fields.summary: [KYC Risk Score] Risk Score Setting Page

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story*

As an admin,

I want to open list of Industry on same page

So that compliance team can change risk level of industries.





*Environment:*

All environments





*Background:*
From compliance point of view there is need of automatic assessment of all individual accounts basis users nationality, country of residence, industry and employment option selected in application form. KYC risk score setting page gives compliance team access to adjust the risk scores/level of these categories. Calculation of total risk score/level for individual accounts is evaluated as per settings thereby categorizing them as high/medium/low risk. - [~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5] 





*Designs (include user interactions):*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=39%3A1388&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=39%3A1388&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1]





*Acceptance criteria:*

# In LogixPanel → Admin Portal → Compliance → ‘*KYC Risk Score Setting*’ section:
## !image-20221229-051340.png|width=674,height=161!
Hovering on ‘*Industry List*’ button shows ‘{color:#36b37e}*Risk level of industries can be managed here’*{color}
## Clicking on ‘*Industry List*’ button should take the user to ‘*Industry Risk Score*’ section on the same page.
# In ‘*Industry Risk Score*’ section:
## !image-20221229-051453.png|width=779,height=521!
Populate industries and risk level as per excel sheet attached
## Clicking Edit allows changing risk level and enables cancel/save button
## Risk level can be changed through dropdown(High, Low)
## Changing risk level automatically changes the risk score as per industry table in risk score settings page
## Clicking Save button saves changes
## Clicking Cancel button discards changes
## Clicking ‘<-- Back’ link should return the user to the *‘Risk Score Settings*’ section

3. Clicking *Add* button shows pop up with text field for industry name and risk level can be assigned from risk dropdown. Click {color:#36b37e}*Add*{color} to confirm and {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} to cancel

4. No duplicate rows can be added. Error message to be shown ‘This row already exists, kindly check’ with Ok button.

5. Selecting checkbox of industries shows *Delete* button(Add button/Edit button hides) 

6. Clicking *Delete* shows pop up 'This will permanently delete all the selected rows(#number selected). Clicking {color:#36b37e}*Delete*{color} deletes row, {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} button discards selection

7. In case there is mismatch of entry coming from application form and value in table set it as default *High*

fields.description:
*User Story*

As an admin,

I want to add risk score settings page

So that compliance team can edit the risk score of categories





*Environment:*

All environments





*Background:*
From compliance point of view there is need of automatic assessment of all individual accounts basis users nationality, country of residence, industry and employment option selected in application form. KYC risk score setting page gives compliance team access to adjust the risk scores/level of these categories. Calculation of total risk score/level for individual accounts is evaluated as per settings thereby categorizing them as high/medium/low risk. - [~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5] 





*Designs (include user interactions):*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=6%3A839&t=NgFIAg3HveVeudbP-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=6%3A839&t=NgFIAg3HveVeudbP-1]





*Acceptance criteria:*

# In LogixPanel Admin Portal → side bar menu, add a new sub section under Compliance, which is labelled *‘*{color:#36b37e}*KYC Risk Score Settings*{color}*’*
!Sidemenubar.PNG|width=192,height=726!
# The page, ‘*Risk Score Settings*’, should contain the following seven (7) tables:
## Overall Risk Rating
## Nationality
## Country of Residency
## Industry
## Employment Status
## Product Risk
## Delivery Channel Risk
# Populate the risk score/level of tables as per excel attached.
# When the user clicks edit (pen icon) button , the following should occur:
## {color:#36b37e}*Overall risk rating*{color} makes range of total score column editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Nationality*{color} makes category score and % of score column editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Country of residency*{color} makes category score and % of score column editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Industry*{color} makes category score and % of score column editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Employment status*{color} makes category score and % of score column editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Product Risk*{color} makes category score editable
## {color:#36b37e}*Delivery Channel Risk*{color} makes category score and % of score editable
!image-20221228-235100.png|width=52.50308537782566%!
!image-20221228-235242.png|width=513,height=800!
## Editing any of these tables stated above, should make:
### the nationality list/country list/industry list/employment list button disabled
### the *cancel/save button enabled*
# Cancel button discards the changes
# Save button saves the changes
# Editing and saving tables {color:#36b37e}*triggers*{color} changes in the ‘{color:#36b37e}*Risk score*{color}’ column of Nationality list/Country list/Industry list/Employment list/Delivery Channel Score list respectively

fields.description:
*User Story*

As a system,

I want to update and refactor of activating emails

So that I can activate emails more efficiently in LogixPanel.

{color:#ff5630}*Note:*{color}{color:#ff5630} This story is to follow up the OPS ticket {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2885|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2885|smart-link], {color:#ff5630}which also includes activating Chinese Traditionally emails.{color}





*Background*

* In LogixPanel Admin Portal LTD & AU → Email Manager → General Email → Chinese Traditional section:
** As of Tuesday 29 September 2022, all the Chinese Traditional emails have been recently created and translated into Chinese Traditional by our colleagues (Sia Tu and Amber Ho), and have not been activated in backend for use.
* Due to the further release of Chinese Traditional language for ACY, we will need to activate these emails from backend in order to send them to clients whose country (Hong Kong, Taiwan, etc) has Chinese Traditional language.
* Furthermore, our Marketing team would like to get these emails tested out as upon Jimmy’s request.





*Current Investigation into email logics and outcome moving forward*

On 13 October 2022, [~accountid:61d4f155326554006c015f63] checked with [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] in regards to the feedback of activating emails from LogixPanel. There are two (2) parts that need to be updated to make this work - Client (api_cloudhub_panel) and Admin (cloudhub). There are a total of 20 templates, the latest code submitted for Client works for 5 templates, the other 15 templates on Admin still need to be coded. After investigation on Admin code, the template id logic and country logic are messy, and they are all hardcoded. To hardcode these it will take 1.5 man day, but for long term fix and refactor, it will take 3 man day.





*Reference*

[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2885|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2885|smart-link]





*Acceptance Criteria*

# Update and refactor of activating emails from LogixPanel. [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] to provide information.
# In *LogixPanel Admin Portal ACY LTD* → Email Manager → General Email → Chinese Traditional section:
## Activate The *Chinese Traditional emails*, as {color:#36b37e}*highlighted in green*{color} within the screenshot below, should be activated in backend in order to send these emails to clients whose country (Hong Kong, Taiwan, etc) has Traditional Chinese language.
!LP_Admin_ChineseTraditionalEmail_LTD.png|width=2559,height=1371!
### *Note:* The Chinese Traditional email templates were copied over from all the active Chinese Simplified email templates, the Chinese Traditional emails should have trigger logics similar to Chinese Simplified emails, but would be sent to clients whose country (Hong Kong, Taiwan, etc) has Traditional Chinese language. {color:#ff5630}As these email templates were made awhile back, please keep in mind that some of the Chinese Traditional emails might not need to be activated. Therefore it should be cross reference with Chinese Simplified emails that are currently active.{color}
# In *LogixPanel Admin Portal ACY AU* → Email Manager → General Email → Chinese Traditional section:
## Activate The *Chinese Traditional emails*, as {color:#36b37e}*highlighted in green*{color} within the screenshot below, should be activated in backend in order to send these emails to clients whose country (Hong Kong, Taiwan, etc) has Traditional Chinese language.
!LP_Admin_ChineseTraditionalEmail_AU.png|width=2559,height=1371!
### *Note:* The Chinese Traditional email templates were copied over from all the active Chinese Simplified email templates, the Chinese Traditional emails should have trigger logics similar to Chinese Simplified emails, but would be sent to clients whose country (Hong Kong, Taiwan, etc) has Traditional Chinese language. {color:#ff5630}As these email templates were made awhile back, please keep in mind that some of the Chinese Traditional emails might not need to be activated. Therefore it should be cross reference with Chinese Simplified emails that are currently active.{color}
# Conduct QA testing by triggering some emails from both ACY LTD and AU environments. {color:#ff5630}*Note:* {color}{color:#ff5630}BE to advise which ones are supposed to be activated (as mentioned above, refer to Chinese Simplified emails as well){color}.






|*Name*|*Trigger*|

|ACY證券 - 出金申請|Client : when applying for the deposit.|

fields.description:
*User Story*

As a system,

I want to implement 'Japanese' language version in Client Portal LTD & AU

So that we can help clients who understand Japanese to navigate.





*Acceptance Criteria*

# In LogixPanel → *Client Portal ACY LTD & AU* → language dropdown menu in the top nav bar.
## Add ‘*日本語*’ (Japanese) option.
